skill.name: raffle-winner-picker
skill.description: Picks random winners from lists, spreadsheets, or Google Sheets for giveaways, raffles, and contests. Ensures fair, unbiased selection with transparency.
skill.summary: Picks random winners from lists, spreadsheets, or Google Sheets for giveaways, raffles, and contests...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation for random winner selection. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, environment variable access, or external command execution.

content.user_title: Pick random winners for giveaways and contests
content.value_statement: Selecting winners fairly from lists or spreadsheets is time-consuming and prone to bias. This skill uses cryptographically random selection to ensure transparency and fairness for any giveaway, raffle, or contest.
actual_capabilities: Selects random winners from lists, CSVs, Excel files, or Google Sheets
Picks one or multiple winners with duplicate prevention
Shows transparent selection process with timestamp and method
Supports runner-ups and weighted probability selection
Excludes specified entries like previous winners
limitations: Winner eligibility verification must be done manually
Requires providing entries in a supported format (list, CSV, or Google Sheets)
Cannot validate contest rules or terms automatically

use_cases.title: Social Media Giveaways
use_cases.description: Pick fair winners from follower entries collected via Google Forms and Sheets

use_cases.title: Event Raffles
use_cases.description: Draw winners from attendee lists with transparent selection process for audience trust

use_cases.title: Team Assignments
use_cases.description: Randomly split participants into balanced teams for workshops or activities

prompt_templates.title: Simple Winner Pick
prompt_templates.scenario: Pick one winner from a list
prompt_templates.prompt:
Pick a random winner from this list:
- Alice (alice@email.com)
- Bob (bob@email.com)
- Carol (carol@email.com)

prompt_templates.title: Google Sheets Winner
prompt_templates.prompt: Pick a random row from this Google Sheet to select a winner for a giveaway: [Sheet URL]

prompt_templates.title: Multiple Winners
prompt_templates.prompt: Pick 5 random winners from contest-entries.xlsx, make sure no duplicates

prompt_templates.title: With Exclusions
prompt_templates.prompt: Pick a random winner excluding previous winners: Alice, Bob, Carol

output_examples.input: Pick a random winner from this Google Sheet to select a winner for a giveaway: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/example

best_practices: Save the timestamp and selection method for verification and audit trail
Pick runner-ups in case the primary winner is ineligible
Verify winner eligibility against contest rules before announcing
anti_patterns: Announcing winners without recording the selection process
Not having backup winners selected in case of ineligibility
Using non-random methods that introduce selection bias

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: Plain text lists, CSV files, Excel files, and Google Sheets URLs are all supported.

faq.question: How many winners can I pick at once?
faq.answer: You can pick one or multiple winners. Simply specify how many you need.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my Google Sheets?
faq.answer: Yes, just share your Google Sheet URL and the skill will access it to select winners.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only reads the data you provide for selection. No data is stored or shared.

faq.question: What if I need to exclude previous winners?
faq.answer: Use the exclusion syntax to list names or entries that should not be selected.

faq.question: How is this different from random online tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides a transparent, auditable process with timestamps and can verify the cryptographic randomness used.
